::: {.Exercise data-latex=""}

Calculez le pH d'une solution d'hydroxyde de potassium 0.001 M.
\vspace{\stretch{1}}

:::

::: {.Answer data-latex=""}

a. $$ |\ce{OH-}| = |\ce{KOH}| = 0.001\ M \: \text{(base forte)} $$
$$
\begin{split}
pH = 14 - pOH &= 14 - ( - \log 0.001 ) \\
  &= 11
\end{split}
\qquad \text{ou} \qquad
\begin{split}
|\ce{H3O+}| &= \frac{10^{-14}}{|\ce{OH-}|} = 10^{-11} \\
pH &= - \log 10^{-11} = 11
\end{split}
$$

:::
